concept.title: Using the ES-3 with Silent Way
concept.shortdesc: Use the ES-3 and Silent Way to control Eurorack module paramaters.

conbody.p: A is all that is needed to control a single parameter with the ES-3.

p.note: !!TO PREVENT DAMAGE TO EQUIPTMENT AND YOUR EARS, TURN THE VOLUME OF YOUR EURORACK MODULE ALL THE WAY DOWN!!

ol.li: Connect a TOSlink optical cable from the ADAT/Optical output of your audio interface to the coresponding input on the ES-3.
Connect a 3.5mm Eurorack cable from output 1 on the ES-3 to a paramater input of any Eurorack module.
Open Expert Sleepers Silent Way and select the ADAT/Optical output of your audio interface as the output.For help with Silent Way, see the Silent Way User Manual.
Load an ADSR from the Silent Way Template Library.
Set the output of the ADSR to channel one the ADAT/Optical output.
Trigger your oscillator module and slowly increase the volume of the module.

conbody.p: You should now hear the effect of Silent Way modulating the amplitude of your oscilator module. Notice that any changes to the ADSR in Silent Way instantaneiosly changes the amplitude envelope of your oscillator. This same principle applies to all input parameters on all Eurorack modules.
